jess
Class Console

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Frame
                  jess.Console
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class Console
extends java.awt.Frame
implements java.io.Serializable

A simple graphical console for Jess. Basically just runs the class ConsolePanel in a window.

(C) 2007 Sandia National Laboratories

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

Console

public Console(java.lang.String title)
Create a Console. This constructor creates a new Rete object, which you can get ahold of with getEngine().

Parameters:
title - The title for the Frame.

Console

public Console(java.lang.String title,
               boolean doEcho)
Create a console which optionally doesn't echo commands.

Parameters:
title - The title for the window
doEcho - True only if the typed commands should be echoed to the window.

Console

public Console(java.lang.String title,
               Rete engine)
Create a Console, using a prexisting Rete object.

Parameters:
title - The title for the Frame.
engine - A prexisting Rete object.

Console

public Console(java.lang.String title,
               Rete engine,
               boolean doEcho)
Create a Console, using a prexisting Rete object, that optionally doesn't echo commands.

Parameters:
title - The title for the frame
engine - A Rete object
doEcho - True only if the typed commands should be echoed to the window.
Method Detail

getEngine

public Rete getEngine()
Return the Rete engine being used by this Console.

Returns:
The Rete object used by this console.

execute

public void execute(java.lang.String[] argv)
Pass the argument array on to an instance of jess.Main connected to this Console, and call Main.execute().

Parameters:
argv - Arguments for jess.Main.initialize().

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] argv)
Trivial main() to display this frame and call execute, passing along the arguments.

Parameters:
argv - Arguments passed to execute().
